label: 徳川家綱
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 4:  Early Modern Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1991
説明文: (r.  1651-80) The fourth shogun, being a minor when he was named shogun, was obliged to rely on advisers assigned from among the high-ranking members of the Tokugawa vassal bhand.  This was the first appearance of a pattern of bakufu politics in which members of the fudai daimyo, that is, the hereditary house diamyo, exerted superior influence on bakufu policty through the Senior Council (p. 20).  [将軍、幕府、譜代大名]
